page.title: 20"BEDGEBURY" -- ENVOI
page.content:
The name Bedgebury has existed since at least two and a half centuries before the first Domesday survey, is well known today in connexion with the Forest, Pinetum, School and general area, and will outlast the undernamed who have been glad to contribute to the second Domesday survey:
A. Bacon J. Bagness J. Coombe-Jones P. Dineen B. Fletcher C. Fuller A. Furneaux P. Gower H. Lloyd-Jones A. Nipper S. Robins W. Westrup P. Whitestone
and their friends and relations who helped in the summer and autumn of 1985.
.o*00*o.
